intro: Haplophyllum lineare, commonly known as the linear leaf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its slender, succulent stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It produces small, white or pale blue flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Haplophyllum lineare is often used in rock gardens and alpine settings due to its hardy nature and ornamental appeal.
